text: Ahmed Asmat Abdel-Meguid (; 22 March 1923 â€“ 21 December 2013) was an Egyptian diplomat. He was the Foreign Minister of Egypt between 1984 and 1991, and as the Secretary-General of the Arab League from 1991 until 2001. He died in Cairo on 21 December 2013, at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Secretaries General of the Arab League Category:Ambassadors of Egypt Category:People from Cairo
title: Ahmed Asmat Abdel-Meguid
